fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
According to our [Use symbols, emojis, and special characters|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters/], pressing *Ctrl+Z* (Windows) or *command+Z* (Mac) should revert emojis back to plain text:
{quote}
*Cancel or disable emojis*

Don't want your :) to turn into a ? Convert your emoji back into plain text by hitting *Ctrl+Z* (Windows) or *command+Z* (Mac).
{quote}
But this is not happening to some specific emojis, such as "B)" (sunglasses) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page on the new editor
# Type B) to enter the sunglasses emoji
# Press *Ctrl+Z* (Windows) or *command+Z* (Mac)

h3. Expected Results
The emoji should be reverted to plain text

h3. Actual Results
It remains as the sunglasses emoji instead of being reverted back to plain text

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ctrl+Z / command+Z doesn't remove specific emojis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Anonymous viewers of a page will not see the Smart Link to another Confluence page in the same space, even if they have permission to view the linked page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access on a site, and anonymous view permissions for a space
 # Create a new page in the space. In the editor, create a link to an existing page in the space.
 # Save the page and observe that the link resolves the page title of the linked page
 # View the page as an anonymous user (incognito window)

h3. Expected Results
 * The page link resolves to show the page title
 !image-2020-06-02-10-41-59-302.png|width=403,height=221!

h3. Actual Results
 * The page title is not resolved and instead shows the raw URL
 !image-2020-06-02-10-42-55-539.png|width=663,height=203!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Smart links do not resolve page titles for anonymous users

See Video


h3. Expected Results
Only the attachment should be listed in the attachments section of the page

h3. Actual Results

2 attachments are created

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] states the following "_You can include any columns recognized by your JIRA site, including custom columns_", however when including a JIRA Macro issue in a Confluence page, the value of an asset type custom field is not displayed.


h3.  Environment
 * Confluence Cloud (old and new editor)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an asset type custom field and associate it with your project
 # In the JIRA issue search screen identify the issues that have some value in the custom field you created in step 1.
 # Insert a JIRA Macro issue into a Confluence page using the same JQL and edit the columns to display
# Save the page 

h3. Expected Results
The data of the columns are showing on Jira Issue Macro like the behavior on Jira searching page.

h3. Actual Results
The data of the columns are showing blank

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround for now.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro does not display asset type custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using copy and paste to insert a link to a page, and thus being converted into a smart card (inline link card), if the page has ~100 links to the same page, it will freeze. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page (A) and copy its link
# Create another page (B) and insert the link to (A) more than 100 times
# Publish page (B)

h3. Expected Results
Page (B) should load as expected

h3. Actual Results
The page begins to load and starts to freeze, breaking the current browser's tab
 [^links.mp4]  

h3. Workaround
Currently, there're two available workarounds for this issue:
* Instead of directly pasting the link (which will be converted to smart link), type the page's title, select the text and use the *Link* button to insert the link

OR 

* Edit the page and split it into multiple pages
fields.summary: High quantity of links to the same page can cause the current page to freeze

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Using the Task Report Macro, the Macro does not respect the configured value for the "Number of Tasks per Page" setting. The number of tasks returned remains constant for a given query.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create lots of tasks for the report, preferably more than 1000, however, more than 140 is found to be enough.
 # Create a page with a tasks report macro on it and pull in the tasks.
 # Set the number of tasks per page to 10 (any number is fine, you will almost certainly get more than you asked for)

h3. Expected Results

The macro displays the configured number of tasks per page in the macro.

h3. Actual Results

The macro displays however many it feels like. One instance returns ".../wiki/rest/inlinetasks/1/task-report/?pageSize=70...", and my test instance gives ".../wiki/rest/inlinetasks/1/task-report/?pageSize=140...". This is when paging through the numbered links at the bottom of the page.


h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro does not respect the Number of tasks per page in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create from template (with variable) macro intermittently fail to work

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a global template that uses variable(s)
 # Create a new page (in any space) that uses the "create from template" macro. Be sure to point to the template created in step 1. Publish the page.
 # Refresh the page created in step 2. 
 # Try to click on the "Create from template" button. 

h3. Expected Results

* A new page based on the template should slide in from the left of the screen.

h3. Actual Results

* The "Create" dialog would pop up for a fraction of a second then disappear. 
* See attached video:
 [^Screen Recording 2020-05-30 at 01.13.06.mov] 


h3. Workaround

For old navigation layout:
Use the "+" button on the navigation bar on the left to create new page, and find the template you want to use.

For new navigation layout (Nav3):
Use the "Create" button on the navigation bar on the top to create new page, and find the template you want to use.
fields.summary: Create from template (with variable) macro intermittently fail to work

 # Create a page with 3 images

h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a multi-line string using graphql language on a code snippet, the highlight colors will be incorrect, coloring the string as normal code 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/ edit a page and add a code snippet
# Select GraphQL language
# Paste this code:
{code:none}"""
Description of type
Supports multi - line 
"""
type Query {
    """
    Description of field 
    """
    field(
        "Description of `one` arg"
        one: Int

        "Description of `two` arg"
        two: Int
    ): Int
}{code}
# Publish the page

The text between """ and """ should be considered a string and have green color

It only sets text between " and " as a string, not multiple line strings:

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pages are not being updated after being published, and display its previous version as if the user has not edited the page at all. This could be replicated for some users while not affecting others. The only solution is a manual refresh of the browser's tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a page (and pay attention to its content);
 # Edit this page with new content (or remove something from it) > Publish it;
 # Check the page's content again.

h3. Expected Results
 * Page to be updated with the newly added (or removed) content;

h3. Actual Results
 * Page still shows the previous version of the page, as if the user has not updated anything on the page altogether.

 *_(on) Note_* This behavior seems intermittent and seems to be affecting individual customers, as it is possible to replicate this behavior on some accounts and not on others. This also seems browser-independent as this could be replicated in incognito mode.
h3. Workaround

(/) To update the page content the user must manually refresh the browser tab, and once the page is refreshed it will show its updated content.
fields.summary: Pages are not being updated after being published

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[PDF|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-pdf-macro/] / [Office Word|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-office-word-macro/] macros not loading properly when switch between pages

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create *Page 1* and add one or more Word documents as attachments.
# Insert [Office Word macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-office-word-macro/] to view the content of the Word files attached in the above step.
# Create *Page 2* and add one or more PDF files as attachments.
# Insert [PDF macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-pdf-macro/] to view the contents of the PDF files added in the above step.
# Now, try to switch between *Page 1* & *Page 2* from the left hand navigation panel.

h3. Expected Results
The macros should show the contents of the files properly.

h3. Actual Results
The macros are not loading properly. They show the file contents, and then keep on spinning. Here is the screen recording which explains this behaviour.
 [^viewdocs.mov] 

*Notes* 
This also affects the other Office macros.

h3. Additional Info
Use at least one attachment with 10mb size to be able to replicate the issue properly.

h3. Workaround
Hard refresh the page in the browser.
fields.summary: PDF / Office macros not loading properly when switch between pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pdf export no longer demotes the heading level of hierarchical pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create Level 1 page.
 # Step 2 Create two Level 2 Pages that are sub-pages of the Level 1 page
 # Step 3 Export this hierarchy to PDF (custom export)

h3. Expected Results

The page titles of the level 2 pages should be demoted to level 2 headings.
h3. Actual Results

The page titles of the level 2 pages are level 1 headings
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Atlassian document:[https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/customize-exports-to-pdf/]
 "Demotion of heading elements: h1, h2, and so on. Due to the hierarchical manner in which a space is exported, Confluence will modify the heading elements to generate a uniform appearance for the entire space export. This means that headings will be demoted. This will affect the application of custom PDF Stylesheets. It is possible to calculate the amount by which a heading will be demoted in order to have the correct CSS styling applied. A heading will be demoted by the value of its depth in the export tree. A page at the first level will be demoted by 1 (all <h1> elements will become <h2> elements, and so on). A page at the second level will be demoted by 2, and so on. "
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pdf export no longer demotes the heading level of hierarchical pages.

fields.description:
Heading links are currently only showing after a page is published, which means that you must first publish a page, then go back and add anchors afterwards. This causes a disjointed editing/creation experience. 

Workflow (current state)
 # Page drafted
 # Page published without links
 # Published page viewed and heading links copied into notepad or similar outside tool
 # Page edited
 # Anchor links placed
 # Page re-published with links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing a Word document, the document will typically import using the old editor. If you convert the page, or if the page is converted automatically, then the images, particularly those that were in a table, will not behave correctly as they will not have many of the properties of the new fabric editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # import a word document with a table that has images. (this should be on an instance that has both editors available.)
 # If that word document is not converted to the new editor automatically (is should show a message saying that it was converted), then convert the page to the new editor manually

h3. Expected Results
The images show in the table and can be edited

h3. Actual Results
The images on the page will show up in strange places in the table cell and may warp beyond the cell.
If you edit the page, the images cannot be edited.
Viewing the storage format of the images shows that they are missing a number of properties which appears to be the TinyMCE style for image definitions in storage format.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the best workaround found is to open the converted page in the editor, then cut and paste the images back in on themselves.
This *should* copy the image itself then re-upload the image back where it was previously but the new editor will re-format the image using the new editor definitions and all the properties of the image will be listed.
fields.summary: Converting a page imported from a word document from Tiny to Fabric causes images to retain old editor definition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, using the CQL search for watched content for a specific user does not work as intended.

The CQL search watcher=currentUser() yields incorrect watched content count. Documentation states the following:
{quote}Search for content that a particular user is watching. You can search by the user's accountId.
{quote}
Full document:

[Confluence Cloud Developer - CQL Fields - Watcher |https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/cql-fields/#watcher]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Watch any given number of pages
 # Check the watched content with [https://mysite.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=watcher=currentUser()]
 # Check that it reports all pages being watched by the current user
 # Stop watching any of the previously watched pages
 # Check the watched content with [https://mysite.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=watcher=currentUser()]

h3. Expected Results

Only the pages that are currently watched are returned.
h3. Actual Results

All pages that were ever watched by the user are listed, no matter if the user stopped watching them.

!Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 16.01.09.png|width=181,height=151!

!Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 16.03.06.png|width=315,height=21!

!Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 16.01.26.png|width=182,height=69!
h3. Workaround

Initiate any other activity that forces Confluence to re-index the content. Using the "Star this page" or "Unstar this page" button triggers the re-index and the watcher count is updated.
fields.summary: Searching for watcher field via CQL yields incorrect results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
At the moment, Confluence Server offers the *Delete Own* space permission. According to our Server [documentations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html]:
{quote}
Delete own gives you permission to delete any pages, blogs, attachments and comments you've created in this space (regardless of whether other users have subsequently edited the content). 
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution  
Add the same space permission to Confluence Cloud

h3. Why this is important   
This would benefit users who have multiple users creating content in their wikis and giving those users permission to delete their own content instead of asking for space administrators to do so.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Add the Delete Own option in Confluence Cloud's Space Permissions

h3. Issue Summary
If a calendar has multiple custom event types, the ICS import does not import custom event types and *Events* under the custom events are converted to the default event. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar on Team Calendars
# Create two event types (Custom)
# Add events for both event types
# export the calendar to an iCalendar (ics)
# Import the calendar on any calendar client or to a different space

h3. Expected Results
All events and event types should be exported

h3. Actual Results
The events are exported but the event types are converted to the default event. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour.

h3. Issue Summary

When using either Copy Single Page REST API or Copy Page Hierarchy REST API to copy a page with Giphy attachment (seems to be any) results to a 500 error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page.
 # Use "/" menu to insert a Giphy image to the page.
 # Publish the page.
 # Go to Attachments using a page meatballs menu. Note the attached gif size.
 # Go back to the page, click on the embedded gif. Note the size of the gif file displayed in attachment view overlay.
 # If sizes from steps 4 and 5 do *NOT* match, go to the step 7, otherwise remove the attachment and go to the step 2.
 # Use Copy Single Page API or Copy Page Hierarchy REST API to copy the page. Make sure to set {color:#00875a}{{copyAttachments}}{color} flag to {color:#0747a6}{{true}}{color}.
{code:json}
// Copy single page
POST {{baseUrl}}/rest/api/content/<page_id>/copy
{
  "destination": {
    "type": "parent_page",
    "value": "<new_parent_page_id>"
  },
  "copyAttachments": true,
}

// Copy page hierarchy
POST {{baseurl}}/rest/api/content/<page_id>/pagehierarchy/copy
{
  "copyAttachments": true,
  "copyProperties": true,
  "copyLabels": true,
  "destinationPageId": "<new_parent_page_id>",
  "titleOptions": {
    "prefix": "[COPY] "
  }
}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Page is copied to a new destination and Giphy image is visible on the page.
h3. Actual Results

If page was copied with a *Copy Single Page API* then it'll fail with the following error:
{noformat}

    "statusCode": 500,

}
{noformat}
If page was copied with a *Copy Page Hierarchy API* then the scheduled long running task will be running long time, with {{elapsedTime}} reaching 75 000 and starting over from 0 several times, eventually reporting success. There seems to be two outcomes possible:
 # Page hierarchy is copied multiple times (5) to the destination page. Embedded gif image says "Failed to load" in this case. Symptoms seems to be very similar to CONFCLOUD-67045.

fields.description:
Problem: Customer has many platforms to choose from to deliver "Playbooks" with process specific information and how too's from our excellence center  to our people ( Google Sites, Awesome Table, Confluence Server, Google Docs, Miro, Monday.com.....)

Opportunity : We currently have Confluence Server 7.4 which seems not as easy to use as Awesome-table etc., Google sites 

However Atlassian Cloud site  [https://www.atlassian.com/team-playbook/examples]  Seems like the way to go.  Would like to understand if this was built in Confluence cloud and if it has value for us to focus more on one web platform.  Also trying to integrate this with Miro for work actively being improved in the Playbooks. How does this platform work for customizable cards and search indexes.

Requesting some discussion. Our company has over 30,000 users and I am trying to understand the implications of the changes that need to be done to replicate the playbook aproach for our craft.

 

John

fields.description:
Closed as duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-71132

h3. Issue Summary
Duplicate tasks appear in Task Report macro only at UI end but not at DB end.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a meeting notes page with multiple tasks 
 # Enter task report macro on another page ( probably parent page of all the meeting notes)

h3. Expected Results
It should show the right number of incomplete tasks 
h3. Actual Results
It shows the duplicate task

The below exception I noticed in one of the cases, 
Selecting items to display set to 10 is duplicating the tasks.
Selecting the items to display without label set(keeping label field blank) to 20, duplicates the task.
Also, this is happening at UI end. cannot find a duplicate task on DB

h3. Workaround 1
* If items to display is set to 10, change it to 20, 40 and check-in preview.  However, this workaround is not applicable for all the used cases.

h3. Workaround 2
* Click on any of the columns in the task report macro to 'order' it. This will get rid of the duplicates for the moment.
fields.summary: Duplicate tasks appear in Task Report macro

fields.description:
As a project manager, I would like to be able to configure a pop up dialog that appears when I hover over text in a Confluence space, so that I can reference information from other pages and spaces inline with the text I am writing. This is a request for Confluence Cloud.

An example use case would be the embedding of Glossary terms in a statement on a Confluence page. It would be nice to create a term in the glossary, and then reference the definition for the term in the text I am writing.

Having hard-coded text in the mouseover would not be very useful for this use case, since the glossary definition could be referenced across many pages and needs to be the same on each reference.

Our current workaround is to place the glossary terms each in separate pages, then referencing definitions where needed using Expand macros and URL links to the anchors in the definitions.

Finally, here is an example of functionality that is similar to what we would like to see. We would implement this in a user created macro, but are unable to do that in Confluence Cloud.

[Building a Glossary in Confluence|[http://jodiem.com.au/2011/08/13/building-a-glossary-in-confluence/]]
fields.summary: Add hover over capabilities to normal text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When previewing PDF files with / (forward slash) in their name, Confluence will actually redirect you to a "Page not Found error"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page and upload a PDF file containing "/" in its name (e.g. Hello/there.pdf)
#* *Note* when uploading files containing "/" in their name, Confluence will automatically convert "/" to ":", so you'll have to take an extra step to achieve this;
 # Publish the page and click the file to preview it.
# Access the *Attachments* section of the page > Find the uploaded file and click on *Properties*;
# Here, change the name of the file to Hello/there.pdf replacing ":" with "/"

h3. Expected Results
* PDF file to be previewed normally;

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence will redirect you to a "Page Not Found" error.

h3. Workaround
(/) Remove "/" from the file's name and you should be good to go :D
fields.summary: PDF with "/" in their name will result in "Page not Found" when previewed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Naming a page is something really important on Confluence since it grants the readers with a preview about what is that page's subject.
Sometimes, depending on how we set the page title, some special characters can lead some macros that use the page title to break in somehow - which is what happens with the *Children Display* macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page called *A:B*;
# Create a new page called *CD*;
# In the *CD*, insert the *Children Display* macro and point it to get pages under *A:B*;
# After publishing *CD*, copy it.

h3. Expected Results
The new page *Copy of CD* shows the content according to the original page.

h3. Actual Results
The *Children Display* macro on *Copy of CD* is broken, showing the message "_Unable to render {children}. Page not found: A:B._}

*Notes*:
* This is not the only way it gets broken. Eventually, the original page will lose the reference from the *A:B* page and will also show the same message randomly;
* It seems that the *two points* character makes the Children Display macro understands that what is coming before the two points is actually a space, once the macro gets set with the page as *SPACEKEY:PAGENAME*.

h3. Workaround
You can either remove the *:* from the pages, as well as changing it to something else, like *-*.
fields.summary: Two points on page title eventually break Children Display macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Videos are compressed when uploaded into Confluence pages and lose their quality. To be able to view videos on their original quality users have to access the *Attachment* section of the page, and this can be counter-productive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a detailed and large video into a page and check it via the published version of the page and via the Attachments section, comparing both versions.

h3. Expected Results
* Users should be able to chose if they want their video to be uploaded with full quality of if they want a compressed version, when uploading videos to Confluence
fields.summary: Videos are compressed and lose quality when uploaded to Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Copy Single Page API ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-content-id-copy-post]) the resulting target page contains a duplicate / twin set of content properties. When fetching the page's content properties, you'll have two identical result entries for *result[n].key ("**editor"* for example).

NOTE: toggling *copyProperties* and *copyCustomContents* may yield different results; however, the only way to NOT GET duplicate content property results would be to *set both of these options to false.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy an existing page ID with single page copy API method with the following options all set to true: *copyProperties, copyCustomContents*
 # Fetch the properties of the newly created (target) page using the fetch properties API method

h3. Expected Results

Fetching properties of the target page will return a single copy of the page properties and the custom content properties, modeling the original page.
h3. Actual Results

The target page contains duplicate sets of page properties, including duplicate copies of custom content properties, as well as the system-created "editor" property.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround known at this time.
fields.summary: Copy single page API method results in target page with doubled set of content properties

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue/Filter macro won't update its results when its search parameters are changed. Whenever a user insert a new Jira issue macro into a page, and later edit the macro the results of the macro won't actually change to reflect on the new macro/search parameters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert a Jira Issue/Filter into it (e.g. referencing just a single issue, similar to the screenshot below - either single issue or table format will do)
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-18 at 12.44.38.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-05-18 at 12.44.47.png|thumbnail! 
 # Publish the page and edit it again;
# Edit the macro > change the search parameters (as can be seen in this nex screenshot) > Click the magnifying glass to update the search (optional) > Click *Insert*
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-18 at 12.46.29.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
* Macro to be updated with this new issue's detail;

h3. Actual Results
* The macro's result won't change, and clicking to edit it again will actually display the original issue being reported. It seems that the macro won't change its search parameters once it's inserted into the page. (GIF demonstrates this behavior)
 !Screen Recording 2020-05-18 at 12.52 PM.gif! 

h3. Workaround
(/) To avoid running into this behavior, remove the original macro and insert a new one with updated parameters and you should be good to go!
OR
When you change the issue key and search for the issue then you should go to the display option and select the table and click in insert.
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro won't update its results when search parameters are changed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sorting a table column with dates won't work properly. The sort won't happen as expected. Tested using bellow date formats:

h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Insert a table.
 # Populate a column with dates.

h3. Expected Results

The column should be sorted properly (increasing or decreasing the dates).
h3. Actual Results

The sort is not applied correctly.
h3. Workaround
No available workaround at the moment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an unlicensed user (user from Jira Service Desk portal, or customer) access the Confluence instance, they'll be redirected to /wiki/home instead of the space set as home page on /wiki/admin/viewspacesconfig.action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a space open to any logged in user as the *Site Homepage* in /wiki/admin/viewspacesconfig.action
# Try to access <instance>.atlassian.net/wiki as an unlicensed user

h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected to the space set as homepage.

h3. Actual Results
The user is redirected to /wiki/home

h3. Workaround
Directly access the desired space.

h3. Issue Summary

The *Office Excel* macro cannot specify any page other than the current page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a Excel file to an arbitrary page
 # Create a new page and try to specify the uploaded xlsx file

h3. Expected Results

You can specify the Excel file uploaded to non-current pages.
Document: [Insert the Office Excel macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-office-excel-macro/]


h3. Actual Results

You cannot preview or save the macro. 

 !Screenshot 2020-05-15 12.10.10.png|thumbnail! 

In the browser console, you can see the 404 response like below:

{code:none}
Request URL: https://example29nov.atlassian.net/wiki/json/attachmentsearch.action?spaceKey=~554380542&title=uplo&fileTypes=xls&fileTypes=xlsx
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 404 
{code}

The below exception is thrown in the browser:

{code:none}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getCurrentTitle' of undefined
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Office Excel macro doesn't work with non-current pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a page contains a *JIRA Issue/Filter* macro that lists an issue with an user mention on its description, this page can't be exported to Word.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue on Jira and add a mention on its description
 # In the Confluence page, create a Jira macro and search/ select that issue
 # Set the macro to Table view and include the ticket's description on the *Columns to display* field
 # Publish the page and try to export the page to word

h3. Expected Results

The page should be exported to a Word document
h3. Actual Results

The request fails with a 500 status code and It redirects to an error page:
{quote}We’ll be back in a flash
We’ve encountered a small problem, but we should have it sorted out soon.{quote}
h3. Workaround

At this time, the only available workaround is to either remove the mention from the ticket's description or not displaying the issue's description on the Jira filter macro.
fields.summary: Page can't be exported to word if it contains a Jira macro with an issue that has any mention on its description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Chart macro does not render if there are more than 1000 issues being retrieved from JQL query.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and insert into it a Jira Chart into it;
# Compose a JQL query that retrieves 1000+ issues;

h3. Expected Results
* Issues to be displayed on the page;

h3. Actual Results
* Page never fully loads the macro

*_Note_* - This issue seems related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73270

h3. Workaround
A possible workaround, in this case, would be to refine the JQL query to retrieve less than 1000 issues.
fields.summary: Jira Chart macro does not render if there are more than 1000 issues being pulled from JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Iframe IDs of Connect macros are different for every renders, and it makes it harder for developers to query the element using the iframe id
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with Connect macros
 # Open developer tools and take note of the iframe ID
 # Refresh the page
 # Verify the new iframe ID

h3. Expected Results

Iframe ID is the same even after refreshing the page
h3. Actual Results

Iframe ID changes every time the page refreshes
h3. Workaround

If developers need to looks for a specific macro within the page, they iframe ID will always be prefixed by: `${CONNECT_APP_NAME}__${macro.key}__`, so developers can still find the iframe from that. And they need the specific macro id, the iframe `name` should have the `macro.id` which is unique per macro in the instance, so they can query using that as well.
fields.summary: Connect macros should have static iframe id

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to export audit logs (click Export), the download takes a while but eventually times out.
h3. How to Replicate
 # Go the Confluence Audit logs, click Export
 # Wait (usually times out after 30~40m)
 # You would notice that initially, the transfer is frequent but it slows down over time.

h3. Workaround:
A workaround is that use any of the rest calls below, but it required to start and end time in a millisecond:

/wiki/rest/api/audit?startDate=1578618000000&endDate=1578704400000

or

/wiki/rest/api/audit/export?startDate=1578618000000&endDate=1578704400000
fields.summary: Unable to export audit log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Space created with Blueprints, post-editing goes to the unsupported content state.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space with a software project or Knowledgebase or Documentation template.
 # edit it for eg : remove some contents from the template and publish it.
 # It will give an error message stating : *changes cannot be saved*
 # On retrying it will behave as if it's publishing but it will direct to *unsupported content* state.
 # Going on to edit mode, no data will be displayed.

h3. Expected Results
If you edit the template and publish the page it should load the page with the data that the user wants to see or have on that overview page.

h3. Actual Results
It will lead to page loading with unsupported content in the grey tab across the page.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Space created with Blueprints post editing goes to unsupported content state

fields.description:
h3. Issue:

Some pages are not appearing in the page properties report macro using filter by labels.
h3. Replication steps:

1. add labels in multiple pages, ex: label1 and lable2
 2. create new pager and Insert page properties report macro and add filter by labels
h3. Expected result:

All pages should appear in the page properties report macro which contains labels(label1 and lable2)
h3. Actual result:

Few pages are missing/not appearing in the list of page properties report macro.

Note: If we create a copy of missing pages with the same content and labels, it will appear in the list but the original page is not listed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available if possible use the *copy of the original page which is not listed in the page properties report macro.*
fields.summary: Missing pages in page property report macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a page tree macro on the overview page shows archived pages also. However, it's removed from the page tree in the sidebar
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3-4 test pages.
 # Archive one of them.
 # Use page tree macro on the overview page.


So we need to fix page tree macro or bring an option in the macro configuration to show the archived page with yes/no option.

h3. Expected Results
It should not show the Archived page.

h3. Actual Results
It will show the archived page in the page tree macro. However, it will be removed from page tree in the sidebar

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When following the directions outlined in the below article:
 - [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/confluence-search-syntax/]

When attempting to search for Macros in use on a site, and using the correct search Syntax. Pages containing the macro are not returned. Search only returns pages that contain - for example if trying to find pages that use the Excerpt-include macro - the words "excerpt" and "include".
{quote}*Searching for macros*
 You can search Confluence content to find where a macro is used. Start your search string with macroName: and type the macro name after the colon. For example, to search for all excerpt-include macros:
{code:java}
macroName:excerpt-include*
{code}
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to search for a macro using the syntax macroName:*

h3. Expected Results

Pages that are using the macro should be returned.
h3. Actual Results

Pages that contain the string are returned.
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Search Syntax macroName: Not returning correct results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a content fetch API call with `expand=metadata.labels` option, the `metadata.labels.results` comes back empty for some results. It can be reproduced reliably by setting `limit` to a high number (ex: 200) and `start` value of 0.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Confluence Cloud connect app with custom content type (sample descriptor will be attached)
 # Create 200+ pages with the create content create API that include labels
 # Send content fetch API call on that custom content type, with limit=200, start=0, and expand=metadata.labels

h3. Expected Results

All content results include label data.
h3. Actual Results

Not all results include label data.
h3. Workaround

One theoretical workaround is to use a lower limit value; however, this may not work consistently.
fields.summary: Fetching custom content with API (expand=metadata.labels) does not consistently return labels for all results with labels

The *Default Personal Space Content* template we find on our Global Templates serves to when a user creates his/her personal space, the overview page will come using this template - we are able to customize it the way we want.
 Though, it seems that we are now seeing this template duplicated in the Global Templates section, leading us to ask ourselves which one is the correct one and why it is duplicated.

!image-2020-05-12-10-43-32-672.png|width=800,height=132!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page has a file attached from another page which is restricted, if the user doesn't have access to the second page, this user won't be able to edit the page. This also happens when the attachment is set in a draft of another page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page (A) and attach a PDF file
# Restricted this page (A) and publish it
# Create a second page (B) and insert a PDF macro
# Set the restricted page (A) on the macro and select the PDF file
# Publish the page (B)
# Ask an user without access to the restricted page (A) to edit the other page (B)

OR

# Create a page and attach a PDF file
# Publish that page
# Access *•••* and delete the PDF file
# Try to edit the page

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to edit the unrestricted page (B)

h3. Actual Results
An error message is shown:
{quote}*We can't show this page*
The permissions for this page were changed.
Contact an admin for help{quote}
|  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! |


h3. Workaround
* If the file is restricted, either remove the restrictions for the other page or re-attach the file to the page that needs to be edited.
* If the file was deleted, restore it from the space's trash.
* If the file is in a draft of another page, add the file to the page that the user is trying to edit.
fields.summary: It's not possible to edit a page that contains a restricted/ deleted file

fields.description: As a Confluence Cloud user with low vision.  I find the light blue text on white very difficult to work with.   A higher contrast dark theme option (light text on dark background) would be extremely helpful
fields.summary: Dark Theme for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recent work doesn't indicate if the page the user was working on has unpublished changes, or if the new version was published.

On the old navigation experience, if you access *Your work* *> Recently worked on*, pages would indicate if they have unpublished changes. This feature is important to keep track of changes and easily manage content.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page.
 # Publish it.
 # Edit the page.
 # Save (don't publish the page).
 # Access *Recent* *> Worked On*
 # The page will be listed in there, however Confluence doesn't indicate if the page has unpublished changes.
fields.summary: Unpublished changes are not indicated on the new navigation

fields.description:

The *TOC* macro, when added to a page, throws up an error in the editing mode.

h3. Expected Results
The macro loads properly, showing the headers of the page.

h3. Actual Results
The macro grey box is shown with the message *Error loading the extension*

*Note*:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Users are not able to add inline comments on attachments when accessing the files via "Attachments" section of a page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page and attach a .docx file to the page;
 # Click on "*...*" > *Attachments"
 # On the right-hand side of the attachment's name click *View*
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 14.20.07.png|thumbnail!
 # When the preview loads, on the bottom of the page, drag the pin to add inline comments to the document
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 14.23.50.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * Users to be able to add inline comments;

h3. Actual Results
 * The comment section loads indefinitely, as can be seen in this next screenshot
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 14.25.16.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround 1
 * Instead of accessing the file via the attachments section, add the desired file to the page itself, and preview it by clicking *Document* This will allow users to normally add inline comments to documents.

!Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 14.27.41.png|thumbnail!

(i) *This workaround is only valid for the Legacy Editor.*
h3.
fields.summary: No longer able to add inline comments on attachments when accessing the files via "Attachments" section of a page

fields.description:

While the users can search for blogs using the search, the remaining options are still inaccessible from the app and this is a suggestion to provide it to be accessed by the users directly from the app's interface.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when configuring the homepage of a space, you need to either type the name of a page, and select it in the dropdown, or past in its link, and then select it in the dropdown. Check the recording:  [^Homepage configuration.mp4] 

But, if you input an invalid value, such as just pasting in the URL of a page, and then try to save it, the error message displayed does not instruct what should have been done:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 11.12.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Instead of stating that *The specified home page was not found in this space*, which can be miss-leading, state a more accurate message like: *Type in or paste the URL of a page, and then select it from the dropdown.*.
fields.summary: Improve the error message displayed when inputing an invalid value as homepage
